revised_title: Blood Transfusion Experiments in Paris and London
tldr: This article discusses blood transfusion experiments conducted in Paris and London during the late 17th century. It describes a case where a patient died during a blood transfusion experiment, and the controversy surrounding the use of this new medical procedure. The author also mentions the successful transfusion of blood in other cases and the introduction of a new emetic medicine that saved the life of a royal patient.
